positions.title: Director of Operations
description: Oversaw operations for a free youth sustainable entrepreneurship program serving 150+ students across the Lower Mainland
Built partnerships with 15+ community centers and 30+ high-school instructors

career.name: Canadian High Schools Model United Nations

positions.title: Director-General
description: Managed a 12-member team to run North America's largest student-run MUN conference with 1,200+ annual participants
Led logistics, outreach, and fundraising, coordinating 40+ rooms, 300+ hotel bookings, 90+ schools, and securing $15K+ in sponsorships

positions.title: Director of Conference
description: Organized logistics for Western Canada's largest technology-focused business case competition, serving 400+ participants
Designed venue layouts and scoring systems, coordinating 50+ rooms, a 20+ exhibitor expo, and tracking results for 60+ teams

positions.title: Lifeguard and Swim Instructor
description: Maintained vigilant surveillance and administered first aid for 1,000+ daily patrons at Surrey's 2nd largest aquatic facility
Developed and implemented personalized swimming lesson plans for 120+ children, teaching comprehensive stroke techniques

positions.title: Project Lead
description: Designed communicative bracelets for non-verbal BASES students as a portable alternative to AAC iPad apps, delivering four user-tested prototypes with 100% satisfaction
Scaled production from one student to 110+ bracelets distributed across multiple elementary and high schools in Surrey

positions.title: Intern and Researcher
description: Conducted Klebsiella vaccine research, supporting data collection and literature review for bacterial immunology and vaccine development
Created 7 informational pamphlets for the HIPpy Lab, translating medical research into clear, patient-friendly public health materials
